participant_abstract.sent: The market research and design team made presentations, after each individual talk the merits of the findings were discussed and decisions were made.
The industrial design presentation resulted in the decisions to use a simple circuit board, have kinetic power and have rubber button without the use of a scroll button.
The companys speech recognition was discussed and it was decided that this would be used as a function to find lost remotes, and will not be connected to the signalling functions.
The user-interface design confirmed that scroll buttons are not aesthetically pleasing, and highlighted the need for simplistic buttons.
It was pointed out that there are specialist remotes, but that we are targeting a wider market and do not need to consider these.
There is current speech technology for signalling that we do not want to compete with.
Market research highlighted the need for sleek trendy remotes possibly with a fruit theme, and a spongey feel.
Rubber casing will be used and the standby button will be an apple.

participant_actions.sent: Project manager - write minutes, prepare presentation.
Market research - continue researching trends, prepare presentation.

participant_decisions.sent: Rubber bush button, no scroll button, red apple shaped standby button (other buttons simple shapes).
